cms.formusercontrol.UserControlDescription: A universal selector based on a chosen object data class.

properties.fielddescription: Specifies the type of the objects available for selection. Enter the appropriate object type value, which you can find in the System application on the Object types tab.

Specifies the name of the column that will be stored by the selector. If empty, the ID column is used. To ensure correct functionality, the column must be a unique identifier for the given object type.

If set, only objects which belong to specified site are retrieved (if the object has SiteID column). If null or empty, all objects are retrieved. Use #currentsite for CurrentSite and #global for global objects.
Determines the format of the name used for objects in the selector. Macros in format {%ColumnName%} may be used to load values from the displayed objects.
Determines the design and behavior of the selection dialog.

settings.Options: 0;Single text box 1;Single drop down list 2;Multiple 3;Multiple text box 4;Single button 5;Multiple button 6;Single transformation

properties.fielddescription: Specifies the names of columns that should be loaded with the objects of the specified data class (in addition to the columns required by default).
Base WHERE condition applied to the objects offered for selection. Applies to the multiple selection grid, dropdownlist, single and multiple selection dialogs.
Sets the order of the items offered for selection via a standard ORDER BY clause. Applies to the multiple selection grid, dropdownlist, single and multiple selection dialogs.
Can be used to specify the name of the column that determines if the selected object is enabled.
If multi-selection is enabled, the selected values are separated by the specified character. The default separator is a semicolon (";").
If enabled, users will be able to manually edit the selected value in textbox mode.
Indicates whether auto-complete functionality should be used for drop down list mode.
Transformation may contain macros (e.g. {%FirstName%} {%LastName%}) and HTML code to format the output. If empty, the object display name is returned.
Transformation used in case no object was selected. Optional.
If true, the output is encoded.

Specifies, whether the selector allows empty selection. If the dialog allows empty selection, it displays the (none) field in the DDL variant and a Clear button in Textbox mode (default true). With multiple selection it returns an empty string, otherwise it returns 0.
Specifies, whether the selector offers the a default option. If the dialog allows default selection, it displays the (default) field in DDL mode.

Specifies, whether the selector allows selection of all items. If the dialog allows selection of all items, it displays the (all) field in DDL mode. When this option is selected, the Uniselector doesn't load any data from the database, it just returns the -1 value and external code must handle the loading of data.
Allows to define additional special fields for selection in DDL mode.
Specifies the path to the image used in the title of the selection dialog.
Sets a prefix that will be used in the full names of resource strings in the selector. The default value is "General".
Specifies whether the selector should resolve localization macros.

The number of maximum displayed total items in the dropdownlist selection (excluding the special and generic items). The default value is 50. If exceeded, only the number of items set by the MaxDisplayedItems parameter will be displayed.

Sets the maximum number of displayed items in drop-down list mode (excluding the special and generic items). The default value is 25. If the number is exceeded, the remaining items can be selected through the (more..) option.
Default number of items displayed per page. Applies to the multiple selection grid, drop-down list, single and multiple selection dialogs. The default value is 25.
Indicates whether the '.' prefix should be added to the names of global objects in the selected value.
Indicates whether a suffix should be added to the names of global objects in the selection list.
Specifies the suffix added to the names of global objects in the selection list (if the AddGlobalObjectSuffix parameter is enabled). The default value is "(global)".
Replaces items which don't have any visible value to be displayed. The default value is  .

Indicates whether multiple commas should be removed from the names of the offered items. This can happen if the DisplayNameFormat is in format {%column1%}, {%column2%}, {column3} and column2 is empty.
Gets or sets the identifiers of items that should be disabled for the selection dialog in multiple choice mode. Identifiers are separated by semicolons.
Gets or sets explanation text if button for adding new items is disabled in Multiple mode.
Additional URL parameters added to the URL of the selection dialog. Must start with '&'.
Confirmation message displayed when removing items. To disable confirmation, set this property to an empty string.
Sets the path to the image that should be used in button selection mode.
Can be used to specify the URL of a custom page that handles the creation of new objects. Only available for single textbox and transformation selection modes.
Can be used to specify the URL of a custom page that handles the editing of the selected object. Only available for single text box, transformation and drop-down list selection modes.
URL of select item dialog.
Can be used to specify the UI element of a custom page that handles the creation of new objects. Only available for single textbox and transformation selection modes.
Can be used to specify the UI element of a custom page that handles the editing of the selected object. Only available for single text box, transformation and drop-down list selection modes.
Can be used to specify the module which the New/Edit item element belongs to. Only available when new and edit pages are defined by UI elements.
Specifies a column which will give a return value of the edited object. Only available when new and edit pages are defined by UI elements.

settings.Options: id;ID codename;Code name displayname;Display name guid;GUID

properties.fielddescription: Sets the path to custom filter control.
If true, name filter is shown in dialog
Sets name of the selection dialog window to prevent conflicts between multiple UniSelectors.
Width of selection dialog window.
Height of selection dialog window.
Sets name of the new/edit dialog window to prevent conflicts between multiple UniSelectors.
Width of new/edit dialog window.
Height of new/edit dialog window.
If true, the new/edit window dialog opens in fullscreen.
Path to the XML configuration file of the UniGrid control used to display and select objects in Multiple selection mode.
Path to the XML configuration file of the UniGrid control used for the selection dialog in Multiple selection mode.
Callback JavaScript method name.
Client JavaScript code executed before the 'onchange' event.
Client JavaScript code executed after the 'onchange' event.
